application

Class UDP

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • application.UDP
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public abstract class UDP
extends java.lang.Thread
    A basic class for handeling UDP connections.
    Author:
    Fredrik Johansson

    • Constructor Detail

      • UDP

        public UDP(java.lang.String thread_name,
   java.lang.String server_ip,
   int server_port)
    throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
           java.net.SocketException
        Constructor of UDP class.
        Parameters:
        thread_name - The name of the thread.
        server_ip - Server IP.
        server_port - Server port.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - Thrown to indicate that the IP address of a host could not be determined.
        java.net.SocketException - Thrown to indicate that there is an error creating or accessing a Socket.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This run method overrides the run method in class Thread. It is invoked form the constructor of this class. It listens on the socket and pouches received data up to the ToServer and ToClient classes through the method receive.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • receive

        public abstract void receive(byte[] bytes)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        An abstract class with needs to be implemented by any class witch want to extend this class.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The data containing bytes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.

      • sendPDU

        public void sendPDU(PDU pdu)
             throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                    java.io.IOException
        Sends a PDU through the UDP protocol using datagram packets.
        Parameters:
        pdu - PDU to send.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - Thrown to indicate that the IP address of a host could not be determined.
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Makes the run thread of UDP to end and close the sockets.
